About NetAppWe’re forward-thinking technology people with heart. We make our own rules, drive our own opportunities, and try to approach every challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, we can’t do it alone. We know when to ask for help, collaborate with others, and partner with smart people. We embrace diversity and openness because it’s in our DNA. We push limits and reward great ideas. What is your great idea?"At NetApp, we fully embrace and advance a diverse, inclusive global workforce with a culture of belonging that leverages the backgrounds and perspectives of all employees, customers, partners, and communities to foster a higher performing organization." -George Kurian, CEOJob SummaryAs a Global Client Executive, you will be responsible for leading a cross functional team, and managing the business relationships that drive the consumption of NetApp's products and services by Apple, one of NetApp’s largest and most strategic accounts globally. You will work directly with multiple Apple BU’s to capture sales opportunities, establish multi-year ‘Design-Wins’, and work effectively across NetApp internal functions to achieve annual goals and drive business growth. Exposure to and working relationship with Apple is Highly Desirable. Ideally this position will be in the San Francisco Bay Area.Job Requirements Understand the client’s strategic growth plans, business drivers, technology strategy, technology footprint, and ecosystem dependencies. Develop overall account strategy to refresh, grow and pursue new opportunities, working collaboratively across organizations to maximize revenue generation and exceed annual financial goals. Build executive relationships within the customer to influence long-term strategic direction and excel as a strategic business partner. Collaborate with a dedicated team of Client Executives, Global Technology Specialists and Professional Services resources to develop relationship mapping, coverage, and BU planning. Build executive relationships internally to influence product and services roadmap development to align with customer requirements. Orchestrate multiple concurrent sales motions effectively (including direct, specialist-led or partner-led) ensuring a customer-centric approach resulting customer satisfaction. Drive the team account planning process, including consolidating and maintaining the global account plan, and ensuring team execution to achieve milestones and annual goals. Develop and maintain SFDC forecast and deliver forecast accuracy by leading customers and internal teams through the sales cycle including pipeline generation, qualification, solution design, global pricing and quoting, and global deal/contract negotiations.Qualifications Bachelor's degree or global equivalent in a related field. 12+ years of enterprise technology sales experience. Excellent presentation, verbal and written communications skills. Strong leadership, customer service, and negotiation skills. Ability to travel globally.Additional Qualifications Consistent track record of exceeding quota by maintaining market share AND driving net new business. Proven ability to work effectively and collaboratively on a large team with shared goals. Background in EDA, AI, IT infrastructure, Cloud Service, and/or SaaS, IaaS, PaaS. History of working in a complex environment on multiple, concurrent sales motions Strong business acumen and ability to creatively develop solutions of value (technically and financially). Ability to develop and sustain strong relationships with customers and ecosystem partners at multiple levels.Equal Opportunity EmployerNetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, protected veteran status, and any other protected classification.Did you know…Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they’re 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you.Why NetApp?In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. No one knows how to elevate the world’s biggest clouds like NetApp. We are data-driven and empowered to innovate. Trust, integrity, and teamwork all combine to make a difference for our customers, partners, and communities.We expect a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time off per year to volunteer with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. We also offer financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.If you run toward knowledge and problem-solving, join us.USA And Canada Residents OnlyThe base salary hiring wage range for this position which the Company reasonably and in good faith expects to pay for the position in the specified geographic areas or locations, is $320k - $430k. This is a remote position. Junior Cloud Systems Engineer (1 year experience, remote)Be part of our future! This job posting builds our talent pool for potential future openings. We'll compare your skills and experience against both current and future needs. If there's a match, we'll contact you directly. No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from US/Canada residents during the application process. Hiring Type: Full-Time Base Salary: $57K-$67K Per Annum.Description:The Cloud Systems Engineer will be a part of a growing team focused on infrastructure services. The Individual must have experience working with cloud technologies including Amazon Web Services (AWS).Responsibilities:Supporting Microsoft Windows Server and Active Directory Designs/implements/migrates/supports virtual Windows environments Creating PowerShell/Python scripts to support further environmental automation for our customers Create and implement AWS environments Building VP C's Building EC2 instances Creating and managing Storage Gateways Creating Amazon FSx and data sync tasks for file server migrations Working with AWS Systems Manager Maintaining AWS Consoles for customer environments Understanding of security solutions (McAfee / Symantec, AV, SIEM, etc.) Designing, implementing, and performing cloud migrations for the infrastructure engineering organization. The position demands direct interaction with cross-functional teams and both internal and external customers. Migrating customer environments to AWS utilizing Cloud Endure or other Creating Infrastructure as Code via CloudFormation or Terraform Engage with engineering teams to support existing customer environments Providing support to our teams for technology transformation and refresh initiatives Partners with suppliers, architects, engineers, developers, and both internal and external customers to provide expert guidance to project stakeholders on upcoming and innovative technologies Provides specific technical expertise to solve complex problems on project-specific activities. Qualifications & Skills:Excellent MS Windows Server 2016, 2012, and 2008 troubleshooting ability Experience with Linux Expert knowledge of Active Directory Experience with AWS / Azure Experience in building highly available environments Experience with VMware virtualization technologies Experience and knowledge of the Cloud including Infrastructure as a Service, and public and private cloud solutions. Database migration experience Hands-on experience with server and operating system technologies Hands-on experience with virtualization technologies Data Center/Server Operational Components (Monitoring, Management, etc.). Demonstrated ability to be a team player in a fast-paced environment Attention to detail, results driven with focus on high quality and excellent customer service as well as the ability to multi-task. Ability to keep calm during a period of crisis and to provide the leadership and direction required to resolve the issue. Can perform independently with minimal supervision and make decisions in ambiguity. Strong emphasis on following ITIL standards and maintaining regulatory compliance. Preferred Certifications Experience with Linux Experience with storage platforms Experience with Veeam Backup solution Experience with clustering and certification with hypervisor technologies Education:Bachelor's Degree or 1 year of extensive IT experience in multiple disciplines Certifications in AWS Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Preferred VMware Certified Professional (VCP) Preferred Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) Preferred

Natixis is looking for an experienced attorney to join the Legal Department to provide legal and regulatory advice with respect to structured note issuances, treasury products, equity derivatives activities, proprietary indices, financial engineering matters, as well as repo and securities lending activities within the Corporate and Investment Banking division. The attorney will join a 25-person legal department.He/she/they will be responsible for providing advice and guidance for a variety of structured transactions. The primary areas of responsibility will be:drafting, reviewing and advising on program and issuance documentation for structured note offerings, proprietary indices, repurchase transactions, securities lending transactions and equity derivatives transactions; advising on other treasury products and other financial engineering / global securities financing matters as needed;working with the business team and support functions on transaction structuring and new product development;work with legal colleagues in both New York and Paris to assist with or coordinate multi-jurisdictional, cross-border legal documentation and due diligence;taking all necessary steps to ensure a proper understanding of legal risks incurred by the structured equities team and the Global Securities Finance team and providing appropriate solutions in order to control and reduce legal risks;coordinating with the Head Office and other locations to promote transparency and consistency in approach;providing legal analysis on new products and contributions for the New Product Committee, as necessary;instructing and managing external counsel and legal fees.Requirements:JD or LLM degree.6+ years of relevant work experience at a law firm or financial institutionEffective verbal and interpersonal skills.Skillful written communication, including the ability to convey thoughts clearly and succinctly and to communicate pertinent, complex information in a clear and organized manner.Strong analytical and organizational skills.The ability to manage multiple priorities, working under pressure to meet deadlines, and the ability to respond creatively and quickly in a fast-paced and changing environment.Self-motivated with the ability to work independently while understanding when to involve other team members as needed and to work effectively in a team environment.Qualified candidates must be admitted to the bar of the State of New York as an active member in good standing or registered (or qualified to register) as in-house counsel under the Rules of the Court of Appeals of the State of New York. NY bar candidates may also be considered.Natixis is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a workplace free of discrimination. Natixis will not tolerate any form of discrimination based on age, color, mental or physical handicap or disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, alienage, ancestry or citizenship status, race, religion, sex (including sex stereotyping, gender identity, gender expression or transgender status), veteran status, creed, genetic information or carrier status, or any other protected characteristic as established by law. Respect for all means that we deal with each person as an individual and not as a member of any group. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. Management is expected to provide leadership in supporting the firms EEO program by taking steps to promote EEO in all facets of employment including recruitment, hiring, retention, promotion, performance assessment, and career-development opportunities. The salary range for this position will be between $250,000 - $285,000. Natixis is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. Actual base salary will vary and will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, education, skills set, applicable licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. Base salary is only one component of our total rewards package. Natixis also offers a generous benefits package, and you may be eligible for a discretionary incentive award depending on company and individual performance.

full description: Job DescriptionDynaFlex is dedicated to exceeding industry standards with our commitment to quality and innovation. Desired Skills (not required):Experience with ISO 9001 or 13485 quality systems. Previous auditing or training experience. Background in the orthodontic or dental industry. About Our ClientOur client is lifting the curtain on the largest financial market in the world: structured finance. The $16+ trillion market is the backbone of everyday activities that empower financial freedom, from consolidating credit card debt and refinancing student loans, to buying a home and starting a small business.The data analytics platform brings unparalleled transparency into investment performance and risk for lenders and Wall Street investors in structured products. As a data-first company, critical loan data is wrangled to build modern analytical tools that enable strategic decision-making for responsible lending. In a nutshell, the hiring company is helping prevent a repeat of the 2008 global financial crisis by offering the data and tools required to make smarter data-driven decisions resulting in a safer world for all of us. More than 400 of the largest financial institutions use the hiring company for our coverage of over 75 million loans spanning mortgages, personal loans, auto, buy-now-pay-later programs, small business, and student loans. The hiring company continues to expand coverage of new markets, adding loans monthly, and developing new technologies for the structured products universe.About the Role:Our clint is seeking a dynamic and experienced professional to join the team as the Head of Client Success. In this pivotal role, the successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring exceptional customer experiences throughout their journey with products and services. As a key member of the leadership team, they will play a crucial role in shaping and executing strategies that optimize customer satisfaction and maximize revenue streams. Reporting directly to the COO and having indirect reporting responsibilities to the parent company, Fitch Solutions.Key Responsibilities:Client Success:Lead and develop high-performing Account Management, Product Specialist, and Customer Support teamsDefine and implement customer success strategies to drive customer retention, satisfaction, and loyaltyDevelop and maintain the metrics, health scores, and KPIs relevant to each account.Closely monitor the AM pipeline, analyzing the progress of deals at each stage and identify potential bottlenecks or opportunities for improvementIncrease product adoption, customer loyalty, and retention, and customer satisfaction while actively setting and contributing to churn reduction tacticsRevenue Leadership:Develop and implement revenue growth strategies in alignment with overall business objectivesCollaborate with sales, marketing, and product teams to identify new business opportunities and optimize existing revenue streamsEstablish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track and measure revenue performanceWork closely with sales, account management, and finance leadership to develop accurate and reliable forecasting. Provide insights and recommendations based on pipeline analysis and market trends to support effective sales planning and resource allocationCross-Functional Collaboration:Foster collaboration between sales, marketing, account management, product specialists, customer support, and product to ensure a unified and seamless customer experienceWork closely with product teams to incorporate customer feedback and insights into product developmentCustomer Lifecycle Management:Oversee the entire customer lifecycle, from onboarding through retention and expansionDevelop and implement customer segmentation strategies to tailor offerings and services to different customer needsData-Driven Decision Making:Leverage data analytics to gain insights into customer behavior, preferences, and trendsUtilize data to make informed decisions regarding revenue strategies and customer success initiativesTeam Development:Recruit, train, and mentor a high-performing teamFoster a culture of continuous improvement, collaboration, and innovation within the Client Success teamsWhat You Bring:Proven track record of success in client success rolesStrong understanding of SaaS and/or subscription-based business modelsStrong understanding of capital markets, structured credit is a plusExceptional leadership and interpersonal skillsAnalytical mindset with the ability to translate data into actionable strategiesDemonstrated ability to drive cross-functional collaborationExperience in team management and development, leading Account Management teams in the pastExperience in Rev OpsQualifications :Bachelor’s degree 10+ years of experience 5+ in a management roleSalary RangeIn good faith, the salary range for this role is $200,000 - $225,000 but are not tied to it. The final offer amount will be at the company’s sole discretion and determined by multiple factors, including years and depth of experience, expertise, and other business considerations.BenefitsUnlimited PTOIn-House Personal & Performance Development Coach$1,000 Learning & Development FundRemote-First EnvironmentHealth Care and Financial PlanningFree Equinox Membership or $1,650 Annual Fitness FundNew Family Bonding

Job DescriptionPosition Title:  ASSISTANT GENERAL MANAGER or Manager On DutyReports To: General ManagerBenefits: Yes, Medical/Dental/VisionPaid Time Off: YesOVERVIEW:The Assistant General Manager or Manager On Duty will support the General Manager to help lead and support a team dedicated to delivering an excellent experience and revenue growth simultaneously with an opportunity to contribute to every level of the gym's overall success. The Assistant General Manager is an extension of the General Manager and will oversee all operations when the General Manager is not in the facility, including shared oversight of all CLUB4 operations in that assigned facility with focus on such things as providing a superior customer experience, establishing community partnerships to enhance business-to-business relationships within the community as well as to raise awareness and recognition of the organization in the community and drive membership sales, and also in hiring, then coaching/mentoring and developing a full staff within the established operational budgets..The Assistant General Manager or Manager On Duty is responsible for helping in achieving targeted results in the areas of financial sustainability, customer satisfaction, revenue/sales performance, and financial returns. S/he will be accountable for the successful management, administration, and daily operations of the gym. CLUB4 seeks a future leader who is results-oriented and committed to quality service.ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and or ability required.Reliable service as scheduled; significant organizational skills; an ability to lead others in the absence of the General Manager.Sales duties to include making phone calls to prospective members that have been to the club or have shown interest in joining via online communications. Strong sales background helpful. Responsible for the overall sales numbers at the locationAssist in maintaining a welcoming atmosphere for all members, prospective members and guests and ensuring staff follows superior customer service guidelinesProvide support to the staff so they can achieve growth in while also providing them the opportunity to develop their skillsCollaborate with the General Manager and Regional Manager to appropriately address all issues within the club, and on-line, involving both employees and members while ensuring that all are addressed in an appropriate, respectful and timely mannerPromote a superior customer experience within the clubActively promote Club4Fitness within local communitiesPerformance Requirements of the GM include:Partner with General Manager to grow the Club business in regard to sales profit, and to motivate staff to achieve this same goalEnsure accurate and timely daily depositsEnsure and monitor compliance with all policies, procedures, and organizational standardsMonitor inventory in the club, ensuring there are adequate supplies. Monitor and oversee employee payroll and scheduling ensuring the club is adequately staffed at all timesResponsible for keeping the facility clean and able to pass inspectionsSchedule and reassign staff personnel in order to meet Club needs in the absence of the General ManagerMaintain strict confidentiality of proprietary and/or sensitive informationPartner with GM and MOD to manage team members to ensure strong communication with the goal of developing effective working relationships and provide an inviting experience for members and prospective members. Responsible for complete knowledge, understanding, and strict adherence to company policies and proceduresOther duties as assigned by the General or Regional Manager or Managing PartnerORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:The position reports directly to the General Manager in charge of CLUB operations under the direction of an assigned Regional Manager.REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Knowledge, skills & abilities: Hard working, goal oriented, enthusiastic, and energetic. Solid work ethic with strong decision-making skillsSelf-starter who takes initiative with minimal direction and supervisionBasic computer, math, and communication skills requiredSuperior customer service skills, preferably in the fitness industrySolid supervisory, diplomacy and listening skillsBoth detail and results-oriented with high degree of professionalism and organizational skillsStrong communication, problem-solving, time management and analytical skillsStrong time management skills, ability to effectively manage multiple priorities in a rapidly changing environmentDemonstrated ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively within teamsPossess a working knowledge of all purchasing/sales web-based programming and fitness software utilized by C4F as it relates to sales of services to membersMust be computer proficient and well versed in Microsoft Office Suite. Strong track record of successfully executing on tasks and duties assigned by General ManagerDesire to learn to manage Club operations; Maintain responsibilities over Club operations personnel in the absence of the General ManagerAbility to travel to other clubs as needed Minimum certifications/education/experience level: Some supervisory or leadership experience in a high-level customer service industry, preferredHigh School Diploma or equivalent (GED) is required; 2- or 4-yr degree or four years of supervisory experience is preferredMust be CPR/AED certifiedReasonable accommodations may be possible to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.WORK ENVIRONMENT: Work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Mental Demands: Reading; ability to communicate effectively (verbal and written); maintain emotional control under pressurePhysical Demands/Environmental Factors: Work with frequent interruptions; climbing, stretching, frequent light lifting of books, boxes; occasional lifting of up to 50 pounds; frequent use of computer and repetitive hand motionsRegulated air temperature and humidity in gym facilities and office environment, however, temperatures and humidity may be elevated while group and personal exercise activities are being performedRegular standing, walking, crouching, kneeling, stretching, lifting, and other physical activity are required while performing the duties of the roleSitting, close reading, and typing are required while performing the duties of the roleNoise level is generally low but may be louder and more intense in gym facilitiesTravel will be required as described aboveHours are generally traditional business hours but may, at times, extend to long or late hours to accommodate the different time zones of club facilities as well as to address projects and other matters involving social mediaACKNOWLEDGEMENT: Any work related experience or additional education/training resulting in acceptable proficiency levels in the above required knowledge, skills, and abilities may be an acceptable substitute for the above specified education and experience requirements at the sole discretion of Club4Fitness Human Resources or the Managing Partner. Job DescriptionInventory Control CoordinatorAmanda Blu & Co is a fashion manufacturing company located in Shawnee Kansas. We are looking for an experienced Inventory Control Coordinator to join our warehouse management team.As an Inventory Coordinator, you are responsible for the accuracy of all inventory. You will oversee efficiency and incorporate the best supply chain practices to minimize inventory loss. Additionally, you will be responsible for training and mentoring staff to ensure they use systems appropriately.The ideal Inventory Coordinator will hold a degree in business or a related field and have 2+ years of experience in an inventory role. We use an ERP system (NetSuite) to maintain accurate inventory.This position reports to our Operations Manager with dotted line reporting to President and CFO.This position will supervise Saturday shifts 2-3 times per month and will ideally start their shift at 5:00 a.m.Responsibilities:Ensure accuracy of planning and inventory data by leading and performing cycle counting as defined in established procedures as well as material availability checks, picking, packing and shipment validations, receiving validations and reconciling inventory for several virtual locations as well as two physical locations. Manage inventory and processes using FIFO method. Work closely with distribution management to provide consistent feedback of inventory records. Mentor warehouse staff. Provide guidance and training to distribution personnel to prevent inventory errors. Identifies and coordinates activities among distribution, materials, and engineering groups to identify and implement processes that will lead to improved inventory accuracy. Conduct appropriate inventory record research where inventory discrepancies exist. Review and resolve receiving discrepancies with Receiving Supervisor. Define causes of errors, reconcile records, publish results, and actively pursue/participate in getting the causes of inventory errors resolved. Participates in the development and implementation of business process improvement and system enhancements impacting Distribution Center control-related activities. Review all new product introductions and status changes affecting the department. Coordinate physical inventory activities with distribution management and other materials personnel. Other inventory management duties as required. Review existing VMS system and provide input for improvements and user training. Qualifications: Physical Requirements: Working environment is in the Distribution Center. Must be able to stand and walk in the Distribution Center 90% of the time. Lifting and carrying boxes up to 50lbs. Manual dexterity for operating a personal computer keyboard.  This position will supervise Saturday shifts 2-3 times per month and will ideally start their shift at 5:00 a.m.  Strong knowledge in inventory control routines and general understanding of scheduling routines. Excellent analytical and conceptualization skills. Problem solving, reasoning, and attention to detail for organizing resources. Written communication skills for memos and reports. Flexibility to handle multiple tasks simultaneously. Ability to handle conflicting priorities. Flexibility and ability to change. Ability to work under pressure. Knowledge and understanding of manufacturing systems (i.e. MRP, inventory control). Product familiarity, desired but not requiredUnderstanding of distribution/material flowExceptional experience in Microsoft Excel, AS400/BOSS and NetSuite(optional)Equipment Used: Stand up/ Sit down Forklift. Computer, Bar Code(RF) scanner, and weigh scale.Pay Range: $20.00-$25.00 depending on experience.

Technical Business / Systems Analyst100% RemoteContract role We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Technical Business and Systems Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong and diverse technical background as well as an understanding of the lottery business and understands or can gain a quick understanding of the IT systems and solutions that support the various lottery implementations. This role will be responsible for interfacing with various SMEs on technical teams and being the key interface to our centralized RFP team who are crafting comprehensive and compelling responses to Requests for Proposals (RFPs) related to lottery technology solutions. This individual will work closely with many various distributed technology teams to gather necessary information and create detailed and cohesive technical response to various RFPs. The proposal should effectively address client needs and requirements while following a central theme. In this role, you will be reviewing and analyzing RFP documents to understand client requirements, evaluation criteria, and submission guidelines. While we have a central team that does much of the main content, this role will include content creation and will require high-quality written content for RFP responses, including executive summaries, technical solutions, implementation plans, and pricing strategies.  You will be the bridge between our various technical teams as well as the business side preparing the RFP response. You will collaborate with subject matter experts, sales teams, and other stakeholders to gather relevant information and ensure accuracy and completeness of proposals. You will customize proposal content to align with client needs and preferences, highlighting the unique value proposition of our lottery technology solutions.  Quality is critical so you will also provide reviews and edits to ensure proposals are well-written, cohesive, and align to the product being offered. You will also need to manage proposal timelines, milestones, and deliverables to ensure timely submission of high-quality proposals. Over time, you will be responsible to maintain a repository of proposal content, templates, and best practices for future reference and continuous improvement. In addition to a strong technical background and a good understanding of systems, software development, databases, cloud technologies, messaging and other technical topics, what other experience is required?  • Lottery Experience - We ideally would like to find someone that is familiar with the various systems used to run the lottery in various states in the US.• Good documentation experience and samples of documents you have written to explain how technical systems work ....some demonstrated expertise in software, infrastructure, public cloud, networking, terminals/kiosks, etc. This is a 6–9-month contract to start and you can do this work 100% remotely from where you live in the US. We prefer someone that is working EST or CST hours as we typically are working EST hours. This contract engagement could go longer or could become a full-time role over time. Full benefits are available during the contract engagement.Thanks,Nandit

full description: Job DescriptionCVP is seeking a Security Analyst to join our growing team. Security+ certification and/or Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)Five (5) years of experience in cybersecurityDesired Skills:Intrusion Detection and Preventions Systems (IDS/IPS)Monitoring network security events in an Organization EnvironmentProducing security event reports for managementProducing security metric reports for managementKnowledge of controls related to the use, processing, storage, and transmission of data. Collaborate and communicate with stakeholders, including executives and employees, ensuring their input into your plans and providing them with updates on initiatives and experiments.Innovation & Experimentation: Monitor market trends, customer preferences, emerging technology, internal data, and industry developments to identify opportunities, develop hypotheses, and define experiments to innovate towards a sustainable competitive advantage.Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and develop the PM team, ensuring they have the skills and resources necessary to meet the company's objectives and increase the velocity of business innovation. Champion and foster a culture of innovation, experimentation, business acumen, customer affinity, and collaboration.COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skills & Abilities)Product Management (consumer): Proven experience and domain expertise in product management, focusing on driving customer-centric strategies within e-commerce and other digital experiences.Digital transformation: Strong understanding of the digital transformation lifecycle and the required cultural and operational shifts necessary for success.E-commerce Platforms & Web Development: Technical knowledge of e-commerce platforms and emerging technologies that enable exceptional customer experiences.Analytics: Analytically capable and proficient in leveraging data and insights to drive strategy, experimentation, and decision-making. Proficiency with SQL is excellent to have.Team-building and leadership: Skills to recruit, develop, and retain top talent. Ability to foster a collaborative and innovative environment. Ability to lead distributed virtual teams.Strategic Planning, Operational Excellence, & Execution: The ability to craft strategic technical roadmaps and execute them in alignment with broader business goals. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, supporting them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.ARE YOU READY TO MAKE THE TURN? Job DescriptionTHE COMPANYJoin a company that makes you excited for Monday mornings! Come work at ChannelMix.We’ve been recognized as a Best Place to Work by Inc. Magazine and the Kansas City Business Journal. What really sets us apart is our culture. We actively seek input from all team members and offer a smart work-life balance, including generous PTO and summer/holiday hours. We’ll also invest in your continuing education.THE POSITIONWe're seeking a talented Python Software Developer to join our team. As a Python Software Developer at ChannelMix, you’ll be part of an agile team developing applications for our industry-leading marketing analytics platform. You’ll explore and apply the latest streaming ETL cloud technologies to power complex data visualizations and machine learning tools. You’ll participate in every stage of software development, from concept through UAT, focusing on team success and collaborating with other skilled developers. We’re looking for software engineers who thrive in a challenging, team-oriented environment!Primary ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, data scientists, and other developers, to understand requirements and translate them into application features. Develop and implement platform features, such as ETL data flows, RESTful APIs, and machine learning pipelines. Employ sustainable development practices to design and build maintainable, scalable software components. Conduct thorough testing and debugging to deploy high-quality, error-free code. Develop and deploy code using containerized, cloud-hosted environments (Docker and AWS). Document code and technical designs and communicate progress to non-technical stakeholders. Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in software development and apply them to continuously improve the ChannelMix platform. Qualifications5+ years experience in commercial Python 3 software development, including use of modern tools, such as a full-featured IDE, Git and Docker and patterns, such as ORM and query-builders, serverless apps and dataframes. Demonstrated ability to contribute new ideas to grow and evolve large data-centric applications. Experience with component design principles and component testing (e.g. using unittest). Demonstrated ability to work with relational databases and other data sources, can write and troubleshoot SQL queries. Knowledge of sustainable software design patterns and experience covering code with automated tests and refactoring aggressively to improve design. Experience integrating with RESTful, resourceful APIs. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and collaboration skills and ability to work effectively in a team environment. Additional Competencies a PlusAWS Solutions Architect, Devops, or Developer Certification (Associate or Professional). Experience configuring and deploying containerized AWS cloud infrastructure / devops using services such as CloudFormation, ECS, Redshift, Lambda Functions, Kinesis and Athena. Experience working with large datasets such as OLAP data warehouses. Minimum ExperienceBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Web Development, or related field (or equivalent experience). 5+ years developing back-end applications in a professional environment. ChannelMix offers a dynamic and collaborative work environment, where your ideas and contributions will be valued and rewarded. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and make a significant impact on our flagship product, ChannelMix. We provide competitive salary and benefits packages, including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.If you're passionate about Python software development, have experience creating large, data-intensive applications, and are excited about working in a fast-paced, innovative company, then we want to hear from you! Join us at ChannelMix and be part of our journey in shaping the future of marketing analytics! Apply now with your resume and a cover letter detailing your qualifications and why you are a good fit for this role.Company DescriptionChannelMix is one of America’s fastest-growing companies — a five-time Inc. 5000 honoree! We help big brands and advertising agencies grow their business through the power of marketing analytics with our end-to-end marketing analytics platform. Learn more about us at https://channelmix.com.ChannelMix is one of America’s fastest-growing companies — a five-time Inc. 5000 honoree! About Intelligence VenturesWe are an emerging venture capital firm dedicated to cultivating innovation at the intersection of artificial intelligence and healthcare within the United States. Our commitment lies in the strategic investment and nurturing of pre-seed, seed, and Series A companies, fueling their growth and fostering the next generation of industry leaders.Our initial fund, AI Health Fund I, is focused on companies that use artificial intelligence to increase efficiencies and/or solve computationally intractable problems that place a ceiling on our ability to develop new drugs, advance them through clinical trials, and ultimately diagnose and treat patients. We are industry vertical agnostic and believe that generative AI and more specific ML models can be used to advance innovation in biotech, pharma, medtech, and diagnostics.Position OverviewIntelligence Ventures is seeking a Venture Partner who will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of AI in healthcare by supporting our fund and its diverse portfolio of innovative companies. This role offers a unique opportunity for professionals within the finance sector to leverage their experience, skills, and commitment towards contributing to the success of a leading VC fund.*Please note: This position will report directly to the General Partner and is not a General Partner role.*CompensationThe Venture Partner will receive success-based carried interest for any capital introduced or raised for the fund under their initiative. This model is designed to align the Venture Partner's success with that of Intelligence Ventures, ensuring mutual growth and achievement.Role DescriptionThe Venture Partner will provide strategic support and insights to fulfill the financial needs of our fund and its portfolio companies.Capital Raising for AI Health Fund I: Spearhead initiatives to secure funding from Limited Partners (LPs) for our flagship fund, AI Health Fund I. Utilize your network and expertise to identify, engage, and persuade potential investors about the unique value proposition and growth potential of investing in the intersection of AI and healthcare innovation. Your primary goal will be to ensure the successful capital raise to meet the fund's objectives, enabling us to empower the next generation of AI-driven healthcare solutions.Strategic Fund Capital Support: Actively assess and address the capital requirements of Intelligence Ventures and its extensive portfolio, thereby accelerating our mission to drive breakthroughs in the AI and healthcare industries. Your role will be crucial in ensuring that we have the financial resources necessary to support our vision and investment strategy.Portfolio Company Growth: Play a pivotal role in assessing the financial and strategic needs of our portfolio companies. Provide bespoke solutions and support to catalyze their growth and scalability. Your insights will be invaluable in guiding these companies towards achieving their full potential in transforming healthcare through AI.Investment Syndication Leadership: Take the lead in syndicating investments sponsored by the fund, broadening our impact and influence across the AI and healthcare landscape. Your efforts will help amplify our reach, bringing in additional strategic and financial partners to bolster our portfolio companies' success.Financial Strategy Innovation: Offer expert advice on a spectrum of financial strategies, including debt financing, venture debt, and other creative financing solutions. Your expertise will be key to supporting the fund's and portfolio companies' growth, ensuring they have access to a diversified set of financial tools to navigate their development paths.Guidance on Exit Strategies: Provide strategic insights and guidance on potential exit strategies for our portfolio companies, including mergers, acquisitions, and other liquidity events. Your experience will be instrumental in maximizing returns for the fund and its investors, ensuring optimal outcomes for our stakeholders.Top RequirementFormer General Partner Experience: The ideal candidate must have prior experience as a General Partner within a fund, showcasing a successful track record in fundraising, investments, and portfolio company mentorship. This experience is critical to understanding the dynamics and responsibilities of fund management and investment strategy at a high level.Ideal Candidate ProfileWe are looking for a candidate with a robust background in finance, venture capital, or a related field, coupled with a passion for artificial intelligence and healthcare innovation. The ideal Venture Partner will have a proven track record of success in fundraising, strategic financial planning, and a deep understanding of the startup ecosystem.If you are driven by the prospect of playing a crucial role in shaping the future of healthcare through AI and possess the skills, experience, and commitment to excel in this role, we invite you to apply to join the team at Intelligence Ventures.

We have a fun, casual, fast paced and thriving work culture applying a team approach in all we do. We are committed to helping our industry modernize by implementing automations, sharing our expertise, and facilitating cultural and organizational changes.Business Development ManagerType: 1099 contract, 100% remoteHourly rate: $35-$55 (rate varies based on experience), plus commissionsHours: 20-30/week, with room to increase hours to full-time capacity if desiredStart date: Immediate startRequirement: Must be willing/able to travel once per month, not extensively and 1-2 night max, once full-time hours are reachedPosition Mission:We are looking for an experienced and motivated Business Development Manager for EAC industry, consulting & staffing firm and its third-party clients. Job DescriptionYards Brewing Company is looking for an Accounting Coordinator candidate with strong accounting, analytical, and administrative experience. Must be able to thrive in an ambitious fast-paced environment and embody Yards’ Company Values – Ambition, Pride in Work, Integrity, Brew Unto Others.Job ResponsibilitiesProvides administrative support to multi-departmental Finance and Accounting functionsManage bookkeeping procedures & monthly closingManages AP and AR administrative functionsProvides Administrative Support To Company-Wide HR FunctionsAct as point of contact between internal departments and accounting as well as a liaison between accounting and external parties (customers & vendors)Assist with tax preparation, audits, and identifying and resolving discrepanciesAlways ready to wear multiple hats and take on new roles and responsibilities as neededSkills And QualificationsBachelor’s degree in accounting, business, or related field preferred2 years Experience in bookkeeping, management, or related field preferredExcellent analytical, organizational, and time-management skillsStrong knowledge of accounting principles and practicesProficient in QuickBooks or other accounting softwareStrong knowledge of MS Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word)High degree of Professionalism and IntegrityAbility to work in a team environment as well as independentlyThrives in a fast-paced environment and available off hours when necessaryProactive and resourcefulAbility to interface with personnel at all levels and manage upStrong quantitative skills – enjoys math and problem-solvingStrong communication skills – written and verbalDetailsThis is a Full-Time position with a minimum requirement of 40 hours per weekCompensation Commensurate With ExperienceMonday to FridayMedical, Vision, Dental, 401k with match, PTO, Free Parking, and other benefitsYards Brewing Company has been proudly brewing in the City of Brotherly Love since 1994. Here at Yards, it’s always been about working hard, having fun, and giving back. The Brew Unto Others motto reflects Yards’ commitment to humility, teamwork, and working towards the greater good.

Job Description:We’re Hiring! Alabama Market President – Birmingham, AL Celebrating over 100 years in the community, Citizens Trust Bank remains committed to providing personalized service and financial solutions to meet the growing needs of our customers. We are committed to our institution’s values of Integrity, Collaboration, Innovation, Service Excellence, Respect, Accountability, and Leadership, all of which are needed to continue our mission of empowering generations for financial success. By joining our team, you can expect opportunities to enhance personal accomplishments and professional growth. Interested in this position and meet the qualifications and requirements? Apply at www.ctbconnect.com. Questions? Contact us at 404-575-8262. Position Summary: We seek a talented and experienced Market President to lead and oversee our Alabama market. The Alabama Market President reports to the President/CEO and serves as a senior management team member; provides leadership and direction and manages the Alabama market area’s financial and market strategies and activities to ensure short and long-range profitability and planned growth for the market. Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following: Leads all market area associates in executing strategic and tactical plans to achieve growth, business development, and financial targets.Coordinates the business activity of the market; targets and maintains extensive contact with individuals, businesses, and centers of influence with a focus on the metro Birmingham and Alabama area; maintains extensive contact with customers and the community; plans and schedules proactive visits to prospective customers; aggressively solicits and competes for profitable business, opportunities, loans, deposits, and other banking relationships; establishes and retains effective and lasting business and customer, relationships; responds quickly to referrals and evaluates the creditworthiness of prospective customers. Achieves all established goals, objectives, and expectations, including funded commercial and consumer loan goals, portfolio growth goals, retail banking and deposit growth goals, fee income goals, and other bank products, services, solutions, and objectives while increasing customer satisfaction and retention.Negotiates complex pricing, loan structure, and loan agreement terms with borrowers.Attends, participates, promotes, and represents the bank in the market at business, professional, and community events, meetings, organizations, associations, programs, functions, and activities to support and broaden the bank’s image and visibility. Serves on the bank, business, and other bank-related professional committees, boards, and other related functions; participates in CRA activities, community organizations, and projects. Analyzes, reviews, and structures new loan requests, including highly complex loans of various loan types and industries; approves loans within loan policy guidelines and up to amounts allowed in lending authority limits and presents all requests in excess of individual lending authority to loan committees for approval.Manages relationships to ensure maximum profitability and credit quality, including new cross-sell business opportunities, monitoring regional loan maturity reports, and ensuring loan renewals and problems loans are handled promptly. Maintains a sound loan portfolio and provides accurate assessments of the loan portfolio; ensures that grading and credit quality standards, legal and technical compliance procedures, and lending policy are consistent; manages the bank’s credit risk program by monitoring the lender liability, environmental liability, loan officer fraud, loan documentation deficiencies, etc.Reports the financial results of market operations, the status of loans, banking competition, and new business developments to executive management and the board; maintains updated pipeline reports and prospect database; reviews and analyzes divisional reports and performance for the market; develops and implements effective action plans to generate expected results; and ensures that established deadlines are met consistently. Provides strong leadership by maintaining a viable organizational structure by dispensing advice, guidance, and direction, creating a positive work environment that promotes good communication, rewards a high level of staff performance, encourages employee development, and plans for management succession.Identifies, recruits, and retains strong talent to create a high-performing team while driving employee and community engagement and a culture of inclusion.Regularly conducts effective and efficient staff meetings; increases employee retention; effectively coaches and trains team members; completes timely performance reviews and meets regularly with direct reports to review job performance and expectations and develop performance goals and objectives; develops clear job descriptions, training plans, career development strategies and plans for direct reports to foster professional growth development and mentor future company leaders; engages, monitors, and develops staff to improve performance and/or enhance skills and capabilities; implements corrective actions plansRegularly attends all Leadership, Board, Officer Loan Committee, Director Loan Committee, Deal Flow, Sales, Technology, and other committee and management meetings as requested and/or required. Ensures weekly business development activities are completed and reinforces them with active, ongoing role modeling and coaching while enforcing day-to-day relationship-building behaviors. Facilitates effective and efficient meetings and training sessions. Develops and executes business development, expansion, and strategic plans with solutions for meeting production and sales goals and objectives and maximizing corporate profit; works closely with the marketing team on the Market area-related marketing and public relations-related functions, projects, and efforts. Develops annual budgets in coordination with the senior management team and maintains responsibility for attaining growth and high-quality bank loan portfolio, core deposits, and overall operational and financial goals.Maintains a sound working knowledge of all products, services, programs, and solutions offered by the bank, its subsidiaries, strategic alliances, third-party vendors, and competitors. Stays abreast of all aspects of banking, business development, new banking trends, services, products, solutions, programs, opportunities, banking laws and regulations, developments, practices, policies, processes, procedures, guidelines, and programs. Demonstrates commitment to excellence; consistently provides superior customer service to all internal and external customers, vendors, service providers, and prospective customers; checks and promptly responds timely to all voice mail messages, e-mails, referrals, customer requests, and complaints received. Regularly reviews workflow to ensure that team provides excellent customer service; adheres to response turnaround standards. Participates in developing, updating, enhancing, evaluating, identifying, recommending, and implementing new banking products, services, solutions, programs, policies, standards, guidelines, processes, methods, and procedures.Informs manager promptly of problems, issues, challenges, and other concerns that may jeopardize achieving objectives and goals and those not being addressed adequately at the management level. Protects customers’ information and interests; identifies and complies with all legal requirements, federal, state, local, and other government and banking laws, regulations, and reporting affecting job functions, market, business development, sales, and related functions; adheres to all bank policies, procedures, processes, reporting, guidelines, training requirements, and expectations. Proactively utilizes the bank’s computer systems, tools, applications, programs, equipment, and other resources to meet goals and objectives. Demonstrates and maintains a consistent professional appearance, image, behavior, speech, attitude, ethics, and integrity and consistently represents the CTB Brand.Collaborates and cultivates effective relationships with all business lines for excellent results; obtains and maintains insight into needs and opportunities to ensure that customer expectations are exceeded; creates and promotes a positive and teamwork environment across business lines. Exceeds all established performance and position’s goals, objectives, and expectations. Other Responsibilities: Responsible for exercising sound independent judgment and discretion while making profitable and solid decisions.Leads initiatives, committees, programs, and projects; mitigates risks, adds value, supports and leads the bank’s vision, mission, core values, business strategies, principles, goals, and objectives.Ensures that associates consistently exceed all bank customer service standards and expectations.Prepares effective reports, presentations, and communications.Analyzes and interprets policies, procedures, processes, regulations, laws, and guidelines.Demonstrates personal accountability and maintains and handles all confidential, complex, and sensitive matters and information discreetly and appropriately.Increases efficiency and productivity; evaluates and streamlines workflows appropriately, improves processes and procedures; conducts and prepares job function and activity analyses, ensures efficient delivery of competitive banking solutions, products, programs, and services; evaluates and manages overall expenses.Exhibits strong initiative and demonstrates a sense of urgency; prioritizes work assignments and projects, proactively acts on opportunities, instills urgency in team members and others, and meets deadlines.Takes advantage of continuing education and training opportunities to enhance skills, knowledge base, and experience; completes all training required to ensure regulatory compliance. Manages other assigned functions and performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned Qualifications, Skills, and Abilities: Minimum of five (5) years of progressive Alabama Market President experience with ten (10) years of proven commercial, consumer, SBA, and mortgage lending, credit underwriting, management, business development, retail banking, marketing, public relations, and sales experience in a banking environment; extensive experience in credit policy and analysis, risk management, compliance & regulation, commercial loan origination (CRE/C&I).Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, management, business, accounting, communications, or a related field; specialized training in business development, sales, lending (commercial, consumer, mortgage, and SBA), and credit underwriting; series 7 and 63 Licenses are a plus.Results-oriented with a solid background and understanding of business development, industry trends and developments, sales, marketing, budgeting and accounting principles in a banking environment with broad knowledge of all banking products, services, programs, and solutions, customer relations, banking and credit policies, procedures, guidelines, practices, concepts, state, federal, and local laws, and other regulations.Excellent commercial credit underwriting and lending, business development, marketing, sales, customer relations, project management, negotiation, leadership, management, supervisory, and organizational skills; superior interpersonal, relationship management, research, and analytical abilities; strong financial review ability.Exhibits strong initiatives with the ability to establish credibility, respect, be decisive, and establish good business and working relationships with customers, managers, officers, associates, business development and sales professionals, vendors, etc. Demonstrated track record of delivering business results & driving profitable growth.Strong business judgment and decision-making, particularly on issues relating to the business selection, risk management, talent and performance management, enterprise partnerships, financial management, and problem resolution.An excellent motivator with outstanding coaching and mentoring skills; a proven record of building strong sales teams, and the ability to inspire team members to meet business objectives.Expert and influential communicator with strong problem-solving, team building, planning, persuasive, and negotiation skills; exceptional verbal and written communication, diplomacy, presentations, collaboration, and facilitation skills; superior customer service, listening, probing, and follow-up skills. Resourceful, detail-oriented, reliable, and flexible; strategic, critical, and logical thinker; service-oriented, and good leadership and management qualities.Ability to adhere to the bank’s professional dress code and convey a positive and professional image at all times; ability to get along with diverse personalities, tactful, and mature with the ability to deal with difficult individuals while maintaining composure.People and results-oriented; aggressive and assertive with a high energy level and the ability to work under deadlines, perform multiple tasks, and manage multiple projects in conjunction with normal activities.Ability to meet performance goals, objectives, and deadlines; plan, anticipate problems, and forecast outcomes. Exemplary integrity and work ethics with the ability to handle confidential, sensitive, and complex matters discreetly and appropriately with proven ability to protect and maintain the highly confidential nature of the company, customer, employee, business development, marketing, sales, and other confidential related information; ability to function in a team and fast-paced environment with a sense of urgency.Ability to display high creativity and latitude when performing job functions. Ability to work well with others in a team environment and balance multiple tasks; strong analytical and reasoning abilities. Ability to lead and champion change; passionate about business development, sales, marketing, and other related functions. Proven ability to develop profitable new business, close business deals and transactions, and successfully sell banking products and services. Innovative, digital, and technology-savvy; proficient in using advanced computer skills with Windows, Microsoft Office (Word, Excel (formulas, graphing, etc.), Outlook, Access, PowerPoint, & Publisher), FIS core system, and Internet Explorer.Demonstrated career achievements and academic excellence. Must be mature, flexible, and energetic with a competitive and winning spirit. Citizens Trust Bank is committed to investing in our associates and cultivating a rewarding, results-driven, innovative and professional team. We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package for our ful

Our client, a prominent company specializing in first aid equipment, supplies, and facilities, is currently experiencing a significant phase of expansion. In response to this growth, they are seeking to add a dedicated Sales and Service Representative for their Middle Portland territory. This role offers the flexibility of working from a home office (post-training) and operating a company van for daily operations.The successful candidate will be responsible for managing weekly shipments of merchandise, stocking the company van with necessary products, and delivering and updating supplies at customer locations with the potential for upselling.Additional responsibilities include light installation tasks such as setting up cabinets, eyewash stations, and AEDs, requiring a level of comfort with light construction and tools. Join VitalCaring as an Account Manager, Melbourne FLCome Home to VitalCaring where we have a heart for home health care! Knowledge of business and fiscal management, governmental regulations, and accreditation standards. Come home to VitalCaring where you will find your passion, find your people and find yourself again. Together we can transform lives and foster hope through genuine caring.Explore your future with VitalCaring today.

job title: Manager, B2B Market Strategy & Competitive Intelligence
full description: Position Summary:The Manager of B2B Market Strategy & Competitive Intelligence is an instrumental role that’s part of the broader B2B commercialization team at CVS Pharmacy. In this role, you join a small center of excellence team and contribute to the team’s mission in creating win-win pharmacy services for CVS and our clients by creating best-in-case solutions and client experiences. You will have the exciting chance to evaluate early-stage opportunities, write business cases, and conduct quantitative and qualitative customer, market, and competitor research to help inform B2B market strategy. You will execute on key tasks and be a valuable thought partner on strategy projects ranging from short sprints on certain subjects or in response to leadership asks to long-term cross-functional engagements with other teams. You will report to the Senior Manager of B2B Market Strategy & Competitive Intelligence and work closely with the Director and other leadership across the team. As a key contributor to the team, you will lead analytical exercises, business opportunity sizing, secondary and primary research, and slide-based story telling. You will help the Sr. Manager on the team stay on top of market trends and identify new opportunities. You must be intellectually curious, analytically strong, highly collaborative, and an excellent communicator. This role will entail many opportunities for developing strategic frameworks, analytical thinking, Excel/PowerPoint skills, and executive storytelling with senior leadership exposure.Proactively deepen CVS team’s knowledge in Industry & Competitor Trends and Client Needs:Quantitative and qualitative market research on industry trends (addressable market, market segmentation, different full description: Job DescriptionDo you love movies? I mean do you really, really love movies? If the answer is “yes!” we are the perfect company for you to work for. You will spend your whole day talking about, working with and being around items used on screen by your favorite stars and everything that goes with it. We have the very best atmosphere here because we share the same never-ending enthusiasm for our product (we are the best in the world at it too!).We are looking for a motivated individual to join our Los Angeles-based team as a Poster Consignment Specialist. Experience in the collecting/auction industry is a plus, but not required. We are looking for someone who loves entertainment and wants to work in a fun, fast-paced environment with our team. Please read the full job description below and send your resume and cover letter today!PROPSTORE US CONSIGNMENTS TEAMConsignments Poster SpecialistOVERVIEW Our Consignments Team is the primary conduit through which we source products to stock our Entertainment Memorabilia Live Auctions and Poster auctions. Our departmental responsibilities are: Helping consignors realize the highest profit for their content and Curating the highest quality content to offer potential buyers. In fulfilling these responsibilities, we help ensure the business’s financial viability and maintain the trustworthiness of our brand. Our Consignments Poster Specialist performs all of the necessary tasks relating to the life cycle of consignments. This position reports to the Director of Consignments with solid ties to consultants relating to poster consignments. This position may interface with any employee within Propstore and with external customers.LOCATION This warehouse-based position requires daily reporting to our warehouse in Valencia, CA.POSITION This is a non-exempt, full-time position.Responsibilities And DutiesCORE RESPONSIBILITY 1: Support Sourcing and Consignor CommunicationSupport poster consultant in all their consignment-related activities. Set up and/or prepare incoming opportunities from potential consignors via ZenDesk, phone, and email. Collate and research potential content from consignors, assessing the potential value and making recommendations for auction estimates and reserves. Participate in communicating with consignors throughout the consignment life cycle. CORE RESPONSIBILITY 2: Content ManagementReceive incoming consignment packages and communicate the safe arrival of those packages to consignors. Receive consignor drop-offs, interfacing with consignors, and providing paperwork to consignors. Thoroughly review incoming consignor content for completeness and intactness. Identify issues relating to authenticity. Identify content that needs restoration. Systematically “check-in” consignor content, including updating spreadsheets, ZenDesk, Trello, and the Propstore Database. Safely package consignor content for long-term storage in the Propstore warehouse. Systematically track the physical movement of consignor content throughout the various product life cycles. Maintain order and upkeep the Consignments warehouse location and the shelving where consignor content is stored. Maintain acceptable levels of consumable stock needed for Consignments activities. Locate and retrieve consignor content from the Propstore warehouse as needed. Participate in the return of unsold consignor content. CORE RESPONSIBILITY 3:Research/Describe/Develop Lots for AuctionResearch each poster, documenting its key details: year, studio, artist, size, etc. Grade each poster, documenting its condition. Take Non-Public photos of the poster. Create final descriptions for auction lots. Review the overall presentation of the auction and ensure it is optimal and consignors will be satisfied. CORE RESPONSIBILITY 4: Manage all Poster Consignor Agreement Activities.Manage all consignment agreement master documents, updating them as needed and keeping current/consistent copies in Dropbox and DocuSign. Send consignment agreement to consignors as content is received and allocated to the auction. Chase consignors as needed to ensure agreements have been signed. Verify and upload consignor information and agreements to the Propstore database. Respond to all consignor concerns and questions relating to consignor agreements. CORE RESPONSIBILITY 5: Manage all Poster Post-Auction Unsold and Default Activities.Assist in responding to “second chance” offers to purchase unsold auction content. Following post-auction “second chance” opportunities, contact consignors with recommendations regarding remaining unsold content. Following auction sales, contact underbidders to offer defaulted content. Coordinate with the Buy Now team regarding unsold content that will not be placed in a future auction or returned. Coordinate with the Shipping team regarding unsold/defaulted content that will not be placed on the Buy Now platform or in a future auction. Additional DutiesWith a positive attitude, respond to shifting needs within the company that may require you to perform temporarily in areas outside of your normal workflow/duties. This is a critical expectation. Document all up-front and repair costs in PSDB. Communicate all lot bumps/cuts from auctions with consignors. Additional tasks and duties as assigned. Qualifications And SkillsDemonstrate a high level of attention to detail, accuracy, and thoroughness, producing quality work. Demonstrate the ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Demonstrate the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously effectively. Demonstrate proficiency in Google Docs, Google Drive, ZenDesk, Trello, Dropbox, DocuSign, Outlook, and other software used to perform responsibilities. Demonstrate strong knowledge of film, pop culture, the collectibles market, and collectible content, including market valuesReceive and adhere to directions from managers. Demonstrate strong verbal, writing, and grammar skills in all communications. Demonstrate strong organizational skills. Demonstrate strong time management skills and work effectively under set timelines. Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills. Demonstrate an aptitude for providing feedback to improve existing processes and procedures. Demonstrate the ability to adapt to rapidly changing environments and priorities. Perform additional tasks and duties outside primary responsibilities as needed. Expand and improve job-related skills through continuing education opportunities. Build and maintain collaborative relationships with fellow employees and customers. Maintain a positive and professional attitude at all times. Be consistently available throughout the Propstore workday (M-F, 9 am – 6 pm PST)Adhere to all policies within Propstore’s Employee Handbook and all safety protocols. Must be able to work in a non-climate-controlled warehouse environment for the duration of a daily shift. Must be able to repetitively lift consignor content up to 50 lbs and place it on shelves up to eye level. Lifting and moving content requires great physical stamina and manual dexterity, sometimes in high-heat locations. Job Type: Full-timePay: $25.00 - $30.00 per hourExpected hours: 40 per weekBenefits:Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayWeekends as neededWork Location: Onsite in personCompany DescriptionPropstore are the world leader in Movie Memorabilia. With a 20+-year history of growth and ongoing expansion plans. They are the #1 Trusted source by fans and collectors worldwide.Propstore are the world leader in Movie Memorabilia. With a 20+-year history of growth and ongoing expansion plans. They are the #1 Trusted source by fans and collectors worldwide.

Job DescriptionSummary: The Energy Manager will be responsible for developing, coordinating and implementing processes to monitor energy consumption with the purpose of maximizing energy usage efficiency and minimizing cost.Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Regular and Consistent Attendance Develop strategies and policies to minimize energy and utility costs.  Lead quantitative analysis and work to deliver on-time results.  Provide expertise in the areas of analytic modeling for asset valuation and risk management.  Devise new approaches to represent results that provide support for decision analysis.  Assimilate complex information into readily understood reports and presentations.  Perform analysis of power market operations.  Solve complex analytic problems to make mission critical decisions for energy supply.  Create reports to monitor energy and utility usage and costs.  Stay informed of current market trends and rebate opportunities.  Manage relationships with energy and utility providers.  Coordinate and track utility account start/stop requests.  Manage and track energy benchmark reporting as required.  Work with other departments regarding implementing energy and utility conservation strategies.  Be involved with negotiations for energy and utility contracts.  Create educational material aimed at training staff in energy efficient methods.  Assist as a resource for scoping, building deploying and launch activities.  Work collaboratively across all functions while building strong relationships and credibility through joint research and analysis. Qualifications:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Professional Skills: Ability to think autonomously and use discretion to analyze business scenarios and make decisions.  Excellent presentation communication skills, both written and verbal.  Customer-service ethos: able to deliver services that meet user needs.  Strong relationship-building and influencing skills.  Ability to work collaboratively and effectively in a team environment and across the organization at all levels.  Ability to see opportunities and potential business improvements, and has the drive to see them implemented Highly organized, with ability to prioritize and manage multiple assignments in a dynamic work environment while maintaining high quality and error free work with minimal supervision.  Strong attention to detail, whilst retaining sight of the bigger picture Ability to prioritize and act quickly to meet deadlines Ability to juggle projects and resource when required. Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Engineering or another related field.  Master’s degree preferred in one of the above.  At least 3 years of experience in any combination of the following: electric utility industry, consulting finance, or economic forecast modeling and data analytics.  Strong data analysis.  Knowledge of various analysis tools and ability to build forecast models.  Experience managing energy usage in a commercial context and creating procedures and process to minimize energy costs.

Benefits:401(k) matchingCompany partiesCompetitive salaryDental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offParental leaveStock options planTuition assistanceVision insuranceWellness resourcesCompany Overview:Avalyn is a biopharmaceutical company developing targeted therapeutics for the treatment of rare respiratory diseases including pulmonary fibrosis and other interstitial lung diseases (ILD). Pulmonary fibrosis is characterized by scarring, decline in lung function, reduced exercise capacity and quality of life, and is associated with increased mortality. Currently approved therapeutic options slow pulmonary fibrosis progression but are associated with significant toxicities that restrict their use and dosing. Avalyn is developing a pipeline of new inhaled formulations of approved medicines designed to reduce systemic exposure and deliver medication to the site of disease. Avalyn’s pipeline is led by AP01, an optimized inhaled formulation of pirfenidone, which has been assessed in 150 individuals with different forms of pulmonary fibrosis and demonstrated clinical proof-of-concept with improved efficacy and safety over existing therapies. For more information, please visit avalynpharma.com.Position Overview: The Director, Financial Planning & Analysis is responsible for executing sound processes relating to budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis for Avalyn reporting to the VP Finance.
